alert.note: Alert for City of Norton; Scott; Wise (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 10:03AM EDT until July 28 at 11:30AM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Scott County in southwestern Virginia... Southern Wise County in southwestern Virginia... The City of Norton in southwestern Virginia... * Until 1130 AM EDT. * At 1003 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by storms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Norton, Wise, Big Stone Gap, Coeburn, Appalachia and St. Paul. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
